note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: The function `Vault()` is public and intended as a constructor but isn’t named `constructor`. This allows any EOA (due to tx.origin check) to call it and reset the `Owner`, thereby hijacking ownership and bypassing intended access control.
Unchecked addition on Deposits[msg.sender] (Deposits[msg.sender] += msg.value) can overflow without SafeMath checks
Low-level call to target.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking its return value

The withdraw function is restricted by the onlyOwner modifier (inherited from Proxy) which refers to Proxy.Owner, not the depositor. Depositors cannot call withdraw to recover their own funds, effectively locking up deposits.

The function Vault() is misnamed and not a constructor in Solidity ^0.4.24, exposing it as a public function; furthermore, redeclaring Owner in the child shadows the Proxy.Owner used by the onlyOwner modifier, breaking the intended ownership logic.
